de.mrapp.android.util.logging

Class Logger

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.util.logging.Logger

  • public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object
    A logger, which allows to write log messages to Logcat. It allows to specify a log level in order to filter log messages depending on their priority.
    Since:
    1.13.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Logger(LogLevel logLevel)
      Creates a new logger, which uses a specific log level.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logger

        public Logger(@NonNull
              LogLevel logLevel)
        Creates a new logger, which uses a specific log level.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - The log level, which should be used by the logger, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null

    • Method Detail

      • getLogLevel

        public final LogLevel getLogLevel()
        Returns the current log level. Only log messages with a rank greater or equal than the rank of the currently applied log level, are written to the output.
        Returns:
        The current log level as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may either be ALL, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR or OFF

      • setLogLevel

        public final void setLogLevel(@NonNull
                              LogLevel logLevel)
        Sets the log level. Only log messages with a rank greater or equal than the rank of the currently applied log level, are written to the output.
        Parameters:
        logLevel - The log level, which should be set, as a value of the enum LogLevel. The log level may not be null

      • logVerbose

        public final void logVerbose(@NonNull
                             java.lang.Class<?> tag,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.String message)
        Logs a specific message on the log level VERBOSE.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag, which identifies the source of the log message, as an instance of the class Class. The tag may not be null
        message - The message, which should be logged, as a String. The message may neither be null, nor empty

      • logVerbose

        public final void logVerbose(@NonNull
                             java.lang.Class<?> tag,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.String message,
                             @NonNull
                             java.lang.Throwable cause)
        Logs a specific message and exception on the log level VERBOSE.
        Parameters:
        tag - The tag, which identifies the source of the log message, as an instance of the class Class. The tag may not be null
        message - The message, which should be logged, as a String. The message may neither be null, nor empty
        cause - The exception, which caused the log message, as an instance of the class Throwable. The cause may not be null
